brewery.brewery_description: Dark Star Brewing Company was born in 1994 in the cellar of a Brighton pub. With a brew plant only marginally bigger than a home-brew kit, the characteristic style of hoppy beers was developed and tried out on the guinea pigs at the bar. The business was planned on the back of a beer mat and funded with money we didn’t have. The brewery is named after a song by the band The Grateful Dead, although if you have a heard a different story, use that - never let the truth stand in the way of a good yarn.

location.venue_address: The Centre:Mk Unit 23-25 Eagle Walk, Unit 23-25 Eagle Walk

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 295 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 60!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 330 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 67! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

user.bio: Assistant brewer / Drayman at Ramsbury Brewery. Did you know I’m passionate about beer?

beer.beer_description: An extremely clean-drinking pale golden ale with a strong floral aroma and elderflower notes from the Cascade hops. This beer is full-bodied and full-flavoured yet gentle enough to make it a favourite session beer.

items.badge_description: Wine isn't the only beverage worthy of pairing with a delicious meal. With so many styles widely available, there’s a perfect pint for any cuisine of your choosing. That's a beer at 10 different venues categorized as a Restaurant. Try 5 more for Level 3!

Sometimes you need a break from all the hops, fruits, and spices. What better way than with a crisp, smooth Blonde Ale or Golden Ale? Basic but delicious. That's 15 different beers with the style of Blonde Ale or Golden Ale. Try 5 more for Level 4!

items.badge_description: Put down those cases of Ale Yeast because unlike other IPA styles, the Cold IPA and IPL are brewed with Lager Yeast and a generous amount of hops. When you want a punch of hops with a lighter finish, reach for a Cold IPA or India Pale Lager. That's 5 different beers with the style of IPA - Cold or Lager - IPL (India Pale Lager). Try 5 more or Level 2!

items.badge_description: As the hub of the town's social scene, your local pub has what you're craving. Be sure to stop by for a pint or two! That's a beer at 300 different venues with the categories of Pub, Irish Pub or Gastropub. Visit 5 more for Level 61!

beer.beer_description: The yeast strain used for the brewing of this American style pale ale is specially imported from the USA, along with Cascade, Centennial and Chinook hops. The low colour Maris Otter malt provides a perfect light colour and dryness to complement the crisp taste and full aroma of the hops. SERIOUSLY FULL OF HOPS!

An extremely clean-drinking pale golden ale with a strong floral aroma and elderflower notes from the Cascade hops. This beer is full-bodied and full-flavoured yet gentle enough to make it a favourite session beer.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least That's 370 distinct venues!

beer.beer_description: An extremely clean-drinking pale golden ale with a strong floral aroma and elderflower notes from the Cascade hops. This beer is full-bodied and full-flavoured yet gentle enough to make it a favourite session beer.

The yeast strain used for the brewing of this American style pale ale is specially imported from the USA, along with Cascade, Centennial and Chinook hops. The low colour Maris Otter malt provides a perfect light colour and dryness to complement the crisp taste and full aroma of the hops. SERIOUSLY FULL OF HOPS!
A blend of Centennial, Liberty, Cascade, and Citra aroma hops by the sack full – then dry hopped during conditioning using our ‘Hoptimizer’ (Industrial sized hookah).

A beer for those who like their hops as an extreme sport, this full flavoured IPA is infused with fresh 'green' hops within 24 hours of picking from the hop bine. A stellar celebration of the hop harvest.

We've produced an IPA fit for those colder months. Red Giant is a beast of a brew! The brilliant glow of this Red IPA represents something truly Out of This World! Tropical hop aromas are complimented with dark fruit notes and speciality malts add body and sweetness. The beer finishes dry, its intergalactic refreshment brought to you by Dark Star. Cheers!
Tropical Pacific IPA
We brewed a big, bold. high-speed West Coast IPA. It buzzes around low earth orbit packed with caramel, pine, citrus and apricot hop notes. Starlink IPA provides refreshment with every serve!

Escape from the boring and bland with this hazy and tropical pale ale from Dark Star Brew Co.

It's a blast from the past that will take you on a ride through space with notes of pineapple and coconut. No umbrella needed with this stellar brew!

Using lager yeast then loaded with a New Zealand and American hop blend - it’s crisp, dry and packed with gooseberry, lime and citrus.

Perfect for the summer days ahead. ☀️

While out exploring Dark Star has rediscovered an old batch of this classic fruity, strong, dark ale. We brewed a fresh batch matching the recipe and blended the two together. What we have created is truly Out of This World

It's cold outside so we decided to brew a little IPA with big flavour. Expect low luminosity from this brilliantly red brew. The malts are giving toasted caramel notes and the hops bring that old school American IPA vibe. Expect a stellar combination of citrus and pine.

Cheers to 30 years of Out of this World brews. We got the time machine out for this special ale. This beer is a collaboration with the OG founder, Rob Jones. Dark Star as a beer was first launched way back in 1987 and won CAMRA Champion Beer of Britain that same year. This amber special ale is malt forward and packed with spicy notes.
